senselogic.sitevision.api.user

Interface UserUtil


  • @Requireable(value="UserUtil")
public interface UserUtil
    User utility interface.

    This interface primarily handles nodes with primary node type sv:user, but some methods can also handle other user types (i.e. sv:simpleUser and/or sv:systemUser).

    Tip! Some user-related functionality in other interfaces:

    • Use PortletContextUtil.getCurrentUser() if you should get current user.
    • Use UserIdentityUtil.getUserIdentity(javax.jcr.Node) if you should get the sv:userIdentity of a user.
    • Use DirectoryUtil if you should lookup/search directory-bound users.
    • Use PermissionUtil if you should check permission(s) for a sv:user.

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via UserFactory.getUserUtil(). See UserFactory for how to obtain an instance of the UserFactory interface.

    Since:
    Sitevision 4.0.1
    Author:
    Magnus LÃ¶vgren
    See Also:
    SystemUserUtil, SimpleUserUtil

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isMemberOfGroup(Node aGroup)
      Checks if current user is member of a group.
      boolean isMemberOfGroup(Node aUser, Node aGroup)
      Checks if a specific user is member of a group.

    • Method Detail

      • isMemberOfGroup

        boolean isMemberOfGroup(Node aGroup)
        Checks if current user is member of a group.

        This is a convenience for isMemberOfGroup(javax.jcr.Node, javax.jcr.Node) using current user (as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentUser()).

        Parameters:
        aGroup - a group node (sv:userGroup or sv:virtualGroup)
        Returns:
        true if current user is member of aGroup, false otherwise

      • isMemberOfGroup

        boolean isMemberOfGroup(Node aUser,
                        Node aGroup)
        Checks if a specific user is member of a group.

        Tip! To check if a sv:userIdentity is member of a sv:collaborationGroup, you would typically use UserIdentityWrapper.isMemberOf(javax.jcr.Node) or CollaborationGroupWrapper.isMember(javax.jcr.Node).

        Parameters:
        aUser - a user node (sv:user, sv:simpleUser or sv:systemUser)
        aGroup - a group node (sv:userGroup or sv:virtualGroup)
        Returns:
        true if aUser is member of aGroup, false otherwise

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
